page.title: 10LIFE IN HIGHAM VILLAGE
page.content: In the centre of the village of {Higham-on-the-Hill}is the{Church of {England controlled Primary School. Built in 1868 the building was eventually extended and also functions as a{Community Centre}the Headteacher acting as Warden.Schooling begins at the age of five-children being transferred at eleven to a High School in Hinckley. To prepare them for the future,the children receive a balanced education. Mathematics,writing and language are taught,and an appreciation for Science by observation and recording through experimentation.Children and staff are conserving an area which includes plans for woodland,pond,Butterfly garden and hedgerows. Donations from the Yorkshire Bank and British Trust for Conservation Volunteers.Help from Leics.C.C,parents
